note.p: Career: Commmissioned by the Royal Geographical Society to explore British Guiana (1835); discovered a water lily grown in England as 'Victoria regia'; Crown commission to survey colonial boundaries, South America; Her Britannic Majesty's Consul at Bangkok, Siam (1858)
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
Notes: The date of election is incorrectly given as 2 June 1859, in the Record of the Royal Society 1940.
